Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Boxtroll monsters have stolen a child.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: They're no doubt picking their teeth with his adorable baby bones by now!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: A horrible tragedy.  Let's deal with it in the morning!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: You're the town exterminator. I'll pay whatever it takes.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Alright then. But prepare to say bye bye to your Brie. Cheerio to your Cheddar. Goodbye to your...

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Very well. Every boxtroll gone. With proof!

Speaker: fish
Dialogue: BOXTROLLS NEVER TAKE OFF THEIR BOXES!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Settle down, men, settle down. Important town business to discuss. First on the docket: more complaints of crumbling bridges.

Speaker: langsdale
Dialogue: Speaking of crumbling... is that a new blue cheese I see?

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: I suppose we could do with a nibble first.

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: All good fun, but we do have this school funding initiative to vote on. Been sitting here for months. All in favor of--

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Well, okay, okay. A quick reminder, tomorrow is Trubshaw Baby Remembrance Day.  And we all know what that means... a performance by Madame Frou Frou.

Speaker: langsdale
Dialogue: ... With some cheese on her bones!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: A lady like that is like a fine brie. Raw. Dangerous.  Maybe a little stinky, but one taste and you'll be begging for... mmm . . .

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: But Father! I saw boxtrolls again!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: They're right outside. They could come rip the flesh off my bones any moment!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Winifred, proper girls should not be obsessing over grotesque monsters.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: I'm not obsessed! I just can't stop imagining them gnawing off my toes and stringing them together as a necklace! Father? Father.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: If they kidnapped me and slurped up my intestines like noodles, would you give up your white hat to save me?

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: What? Uh... White Hat? Right.  What.. Oh, seems to have been smudged by a bit of brie. Be a dear and have the butler give it a wash, would you?

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: I'll give your hat a wash all right.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Hmm. Someone's out past curfew. Very dangerous.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: All I saw was filthy boxtroll monsters.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: I can escort myself, thank you.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Yes, how did this hat find itself aaaaall the way out here?

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: The... wind! Blew it, right out the window. Very windy tonight!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: There's no need to go inside.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Oh, but as a gentleman, I insist.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Can I have the hat back now?

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: What in Gouda's name is going on? Archibald Snatcher?

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Deepest apologies, your Lordship. But I found something out in the street that belongs to you.

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: I'll take that... Now, now, Snatcher one doesn't acquire a white hat by simply--  --picking it up... off the street.

Speaker: broderick
Dialogue: Or being rich! That's how I got it.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Oh, don't I know it, sirs.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: When I destroy every last boxtroll in this town, I shall earn my white hat... and join you in the Tasting Room.

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Good lord.  Not sure who should be more terrified - the boxtrolls or us.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: I was told the wind had something to do with it.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Miss Portley-Rind, your Lordship, Sirs. I bid you good night. I'm sure we'll be seeing each other again very, very soon.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Don't forget. I'm a size six-and-a- half. Order ahead.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Father, I'm sorry! I didn't mean to. Well, at first I did, but I think this situation offers a great opportunity for a father and daughter to discuss their feelings--

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Why do we do this, Shoe...

Speaker: photographer
Dialogue: Get yer picture taken with the Trubshaw Baby! A humorous keepsake for this dark and dreadful day!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Yoo hoo! I'm your biggest fan, Frou Frou.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: I saw a boy with boxtrolls last night! Maybe your audience would like to hear-- OOF!

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: No! / Behind you!/ Look out man! He's behind you!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Wait! I saw you last night.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: You were with the boxtrolls last night?

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Whoah! I KNEW IT! I KNEW IT! I KNEW IT!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Did they drag you down to their hideous caves?

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Were there mountains of baby bones and rivers of blood?

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Did they let you watch?!  I mean, make you watch?!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: I need to find the Men in Red Hats!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: You bit me with your mouth.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: The boxtroll exterminators? They live down on Curd's Way.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Curds Way? Milk turns into it.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: It's not true, you know.  We don't eat babies!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: We? What do you mean we?

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: ... stooges  ... can choose to change their lives. Our dreams are in our grasp!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Now, gentlemen. What better way to dream than to walk in the shoes of those to whom we aspire? Mr. Pickles, fetch the--

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Yes! Those things! Etcetera etcetera, big words, chummy banter...

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Where is he going? Is he getting more cheese?

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Well not here! In this rotten factory!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: In the tasting room, supping on the choicest cheeses... Everyone in town bowing down to me, like a gentleman, a lord with a white hat!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Stand back peasants! You don't touch your King!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: HE won't let me! That pompous Portley-Rind and his gaggle of giggling sycophants.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Let's go... Come on, come on!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: I'm alright. Just give me a hand.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Eww!  You have got to help me, Fish!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Ah yes... right. Open the workshop Mr. Trout!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: It can't be. It's not possible.  It's not right!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Don't stand there gawking. Get him!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: TEN YEARS and NOW you show up?!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: What are you doing with them?

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Boxtrolls don't hurt anyone! Let them go!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Yes, well, I need them. They're my ticket to a white hat, Trubshaw Baby!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: I knew there was something strange about you!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: But wait til I tell him! The Trubshaw Baby! Alive!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: What are you doing? Unhand me!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Looks like the Boxtrolls have a new victim, miss. And her name is YOU.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: What have you dragged me into?

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: If Lord Portley-Rind finds out that boy is alive, it will ruin everything I've worked for!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: It's not just us. All the others are alive too!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Oil Can, Wheels, all of them!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: I don't know, but The Redhats have them building something in their factory.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: I said what's going on? Why aren't they ripping out our eyeballs and eating our faces?

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: I TOLD you, we don't eat people!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Why do you keep saying "we"? You're not one of them! You're a boy!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: No I'm not, I'm a boxtroll! Eggs the boxtroll.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Oh really? Then let's see you fit in your box.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: I- I have a speech impediment!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Oh for goodness sake. Give me your hand!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: It's not true is it Fish? I'm a boxtroll like you, aren't I?

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: See?! I was right!  Now admit it, admit you stole him!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: He says I was... given to him.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Oh, sorry. He says a long time ago there was a kind man--

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: I've tried adjusting the dongle and there doesn't seem to be any possible solut-- Oh look, you've solved it!

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: I-- I'm an inventor, not a killer!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Maybe if I hold on to your son...

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: I think that kind man was your father.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Um... well... a father is the one who raises you... looks after you. Loves you.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Well, he doesn't really listen to children.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: You don't know what he's like.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: But he's the only father we have.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: If I agree to help, you have to do exactly as I say.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: All right, first thing's first... off with the box.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: How do we get out of this place?

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: For this is to work, there are a few things you need to know. When you meet someone, you must look them in the eye and shake hands.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Then you say,  "It's a pleasure to meet you."

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: And you say that even if you're not pleased to meet them.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Lord Portley-Rind. He's usually making speeches about cheese.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: --Bert. Eggsbert. Is a normal name... that he has.

Speaker: lady cynthia
Dialogue: Eggsbert. How nice, I... umm, adore names from the bible.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Its a pleasure to meet you.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: No, no. You kiss a lady's hand.

Speaker: lady cynthia
Dialogue: Darling, it's time to take off that dress and... burn it.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Don't move. I'll be right back.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: But which ones are the ladies?!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: It's a pleasure to meet you.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Even if I don't mean it!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: And, it's a pleasure to meet you.

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Distinguished members of the cheese guild. We were here to celebrate the successful fund-raising for a new children's hospital! But my fellow White Hats and I decided the money would be better spent on this. I present: THE BRIEHEMOTH!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: You're a liar! When I tell Winnie's father the truth, he'll-- OOF!

Speaker: sir langsdale
Dialogue: Yoo hoo, Madame Frou Frou... You promised your snookums a dance!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: We have to get to your father!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Like this. One two three... one two three.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: You made me get out of my box!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Do you know how expensive that cheese was?

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: We might as well have built a children's hospital!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Did you hear a word he said?!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Have you any idea how long it will take my men to fish it out of the river?!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: If you won't listen to me, ask Snatcher himself.

Speaker: crowd men
Dialogue: How rude! / The lad's fuddled! / An outrage! / The very thought!  I saw him bite a bug on a cracker!/ He must hate cheese! / He's a mad man! / I believe her's wearing a lamp shade as a sleeve!

Speaker: crowd ladies
Dialogue: Nasty boy! / Oh, he's awful!  That's the one who crawled under my dress! / I knew he was up to no good the second he goosed me. / My husband is angry so I am too!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: You insult our guest of honor?

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: He's my friend. What he said is TRUE--

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Zees parties are so confusing. No?

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: There, there. You poor, poor dear.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: You said fathers were supposed to help. That they took care of kids.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: People are just mean and selfish. They're monsters.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Not all of us. You aren't.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Well, I don't want to be a boy anymore.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: And, Winnie, I really do mean it.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: We have to leave the cavern.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: I said, we have to leave now!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: My, my, what a surprise. Don't look like your little friends wanna run, does it?  How strange, how peculiar. No, wait, it's exactly as I expected!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: You have to get up. Please!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Give up, Trubshaw! Boxtrolls lost looooong time ago. These miserable pests will never be a match for a man with dream!  MR. GRISTLE!

Speaker: prisoner
Dialogue: When I'm good I get jelly. I like jelly. JELLY!

Speaker: prisoner
Dialogue: Who am I? Who are you?

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: He's my, you're my... are you my father?

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: He was once. Won't get much out of him now, though. A decade hanging upside down scrambled his noodles good.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: No, no no, don't hide. Fish! Shoe! RUN! Get up, get up and run! Sparky. Sweets, run!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Yell all you want, boy. They ain't gonna run. You can't change nature.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Yes. I see it now! A mutation of nature. Self-imposed metamorphosis.  Boxboy! You did it!

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: You changed your nature. Tell them.

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: You did it. You made you. Tell them. Tell them. Tell them!

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Son! They can change. They can do it! Tell them.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Fish, Fish, everyone! Listen! I'm a boxtroll and I stopped hiding, so you can too! Stand up for yourselves! We can fight back! Don't be afraid anymore. Sparky! Fragile! Get up! Get up and fight!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: No! No! No! NOOOOOO!  Fish, Shoe, Sparky...

Speaker: herbert
Dialogue: Look what you did. Look what you did!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah look what I did. They're crushed.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Fear not, the monsters have been vanquished! Your streets are SAFE!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Join me! Your purger of pests! Your white knight who has taken back the night!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Mr. Snatcher, what the devil is this?

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Your lordship, I said I would not rest until I caught every last boxtroll and I am a man of my word.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: I'd say that deserves a white hat, don't you?

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Yes, well. I'm not sure... We'd have to take a vote...

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: WHITE HAT! WHITE HAT! WHITE HAT!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: There's probably some, uh, paperwork... then have a hat shipped in...

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: No. Methinks a deed of this magnitude deserves something a bit more... significant.

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: WHITE HAT! WHITE HAT! WHITE HAT!

Speaker: male townsfolk
Dialogue: WHITE HAT! WHITE HAT! WHITE HAT!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: All right. All right. As soon as that boxtroll is dead, you may have... my... hat.

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Yes. And then we can eat cheese together.  In the Tasting Room.

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Repeat after me: With this hat, I, state your name...

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: With this hat, I, Archibald Penelope Snatcher...

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: With profound esteem for dairy and dairy products... proudly swear to uphold the dignity of the White Hat.

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Your JOBS? Are you pest exterminators or evil henchmen?!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: You don't have to do this!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Sure, yes, whatever! Just let him go!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: I... I am befuddled as your lordship! I... I crushed them myself!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Evidently not! That was the closest you will ever come to a White Hat.  I hope you enjoyed it.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: You're alive! You're all alive! But how?! I saw you crushed!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Oh... sorry. He says they were hiding and then they heard me yelling at them...

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: You got out of your boxes! You did it!

Speaker: workman a
Dialogue: The boy is friends with a boxtroll?!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: Boxtrolls aren't monsters. They never ate the Trubshaw Baby, he's right there with Fish and--

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: He lied to us and to poor Madame Frou Frou!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Why is he talking like Madame Frou - Oh my God!  I regret so much.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: I'll take my white hat now.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: You built that thing! You can take it apart!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Loooord POORTLEY-RIIIIND!  Come out, come out, come out!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: Get your grimy paws off of my machine!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: We need to put out the fire!

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: It's not funny! No, no, no!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: That's right! Pull it over there!

Speaker: winnie
Dialogue: IT DOESN'T REACH! PULL IT HARDER!

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: You think you can win and live happily ever after! They'll never accept the likes of us!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: I'm nothing like you. You're the monster!

Speaker: sir langsdale
Dialogue: We got the cheese.  Lord... Portley-... Rind?

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: Well... what about Broderick's hat? It's just as white and fluffy.

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: YEAH! ARSHBALL SHNASHER, YOOFINE'LY DONE IT!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Please, Snatcher, let her go. You don't have to do this--

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: I present the tastiest cheese known to man. Made from the milk of the male, lactating fruit bats in Borneo. Aged for centuries in SECRET--

Speaker: snatcher
Dialogue: You bit me... wif yor... MOUTH?!

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: Don't do it. It won't change who you are.

Speaker: lord portley-rind
Dialogue: My little angel. My weird little angel.

Speaker: sir langsdale
Dialogue: It hasn't worked right in years!

Speaker: sir langsdale
Dialogue: Oh. I... I don't think that's a good idea.

Speaker: eggs
Dialogue: And now we go like this.
